title: Ticket #4634: condor_kbdd heap corruption
description:
This was reported by CAE. The KBDD is crashing when it is started with an error 0xC0000374, which is the heap corruption error reported by the Windows kernel. This error pretty much only happens when using the HeapXXX apis.

They report that the crash only happens when the condor bin directory is not in the path. Here's the stack trace (using an 8.2.3 release build) 

     ntdll.dll!_RtlReportCriticalFailure@8()    Unknown
     ntdll.dll!_RtlpReportHeapFailure@4()    Unknown
     ntdll.dll!_RtlpLogHeapFailure@24()    Unknown
     ntdll.dll!_RtlFreeHeap@12()    Unknown
     KernelBase.dll!_GlobalFree@4()    Unknown
     condor_kbdd.exe!WinMain(HINSTANCE__ * hInstance, HINSTANCE__ * hPrevInstance, char * lpCmdLine, int nShowCmd) Line 244    C++
     condor_kbdd.exe!__tmainCRTStartup() Line 528    C
     [External Code]
     [Frames below may be incorrect and/or missing, no symbols loaded for kernel32.dll]
remarks:
2014-Oct-06 11:06:19 by gthain:
CODE REVIEW

Looks good to me. Internet search confirms that GetCommandLineW() returns a pointer that shouldn't be freed. There's no other places in HTCondor code that free the return value of this function.
